title: NewsBreak: U.S. Crude Inventories Rose by 3.1M Barrels Last Week
text:
NewsBreak: U.S. Crude Inventories Rose by 3.1M Barrels Last Week

Commodities 1 hour ago (Oct 02, 2019 16:42)

© Reuters. Investing.com - U.S. showed a gain of 3.1 million barrels last week, the Energy Information Administration said Wednesday, more than the market was anticipating, which pressured oil prices. Analysts were expecting a rise of about 1.57 million barrels of crude for the week ended Sept. 27, according to forecasts compiled by Investing.com. The EIA said for the week fell by about 230,000 barrels, confounding forecasts for a build of about 450,000 barrels. dropped by about 2.4 million barrels. Analysts had been looking for a decline of about 1.8 million barrels. fell 1.5% to $52.84 just after the report. They were down about 0.2% at $53.51 before the numbers were released.

NewsBreak: U.S. Crude Inventories Rose by 3.1M Barrels Last Week
